Description: Two joining fragments of oval handle at neck join to sharp turn of Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine pink-buff; cream slip. Circular stamp with rose symbol.
Curator's comments: Ink, deleted, '442'. Name Ariston. An example from Pergamon may be from the same die.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (79)
